intro: Streptocarpus afroviola var. watkinsii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of tubular, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact perennial, often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
